preferences.autoPauseDescription: Automatically pause the simulation when the browser tab is hidden
preferences.solverDescription: Choose the numerical integration method for solving differential equations

solverDescriptions.rk4: Fixed-step 4th order method. Accurate and stable for most problems.
solverDescriptions.adaptiveRK45: Variable-step 5th order method. Automatic error control, best for complex systems.
solverDescriptions.forestRuthPEFRL: Fixed-step 4th order symplectic method. Optimized for minimal energy error in conservative systems.
solverDescriptions.dormandPrince87: Variable-step 8th order method. Very high accuracy for smooth problems, requires more computation.

preferences.nominalTimeStepDescription: Set the target time step for numerical integration. Smaller values increase accuracy but may slow down the simulation.
preferences.springVisualizationDescription: Choose the visual style for rendering springs in the simulation

springTypeDescriptions.classic: Simple coil pattern with basic 3D appearance
springTypeDescriptions.parametric: Realistic 3D spring with smooth curves and gradient shading

audio.parameterAnnouncementsDescription: Hear announcements when changing mass, spring constant, damping, and other parameters
audio.stateAnnouncementsDescription: Hear announcements when playing, pausing, resetting, or stepping through the simulation
audio.dragAnnouncementsDescription: Hear announcements when dragging masses or pendulum bobs, including position information

singleSpring.lightAndBouncyDesc: Low mass with stiff spring - fast oscillations
singleSpring.heavyAndSlowDesc: High mass with soft spring - slow oscillations
singleSpring.underdampedDesc: Light damping - gradual decay of oscillations
singleSpring.overdampedDesc: Heavy damping - slow return to equilibrium

doubleSpring.symmetricDesc: Equal masses and springs - synchronized motion
doubleSpring.asymmetricMassesDesc: Different masses create interesting beat patterns
doubleSpring.differentSpringsDesc: Unequal spring constants lead to energy transfer
doubleSpring.coupledResonanceDesc: Masses exchange energy back and forth

pendulum.longAndSlowDesc: Long pendulum with slow, graceful swings

doublePendulum.synchronizedDesc: Small angles, both pendulums swing together
doublePendulum.chaoticDanceDesc: Large angles create unpredictable chaotic motion
doublePendulum.energyTransferDesc: Energy flows between the two pendulums

drag.bobReleasedAt: Pendulum bob released at {{angle}} degrees from vertical

parameters.springConstantChanged: Spring constant changed to {{value}} newtons per meter
parameters.dampingChanged: Damping changed to {{value}} newton seconds per meter
parameters.gravityChanged: Gravity changed to {{value}} meters per second squared

singleSpring.playArea: A mass attached to a spring fixed to a wall. The mass oscillates vertically when displaced from equilibrium.
singleSpring.controlArea: Adjust mass, spring constant, damping, and gravity. Choose from presets or create custom configurations. View graphs of position, velocity, and energy over time.
singleSpring.details: Mass at {{position}} meters, velocity {{velocity}} meters per second. Spring force {{force}} newtons. Total energy {{energy}} joules.
singleSpring.hint: Drag the mass up or down to start oscillation. Press play to watch the motion. Try changing parameters to see how they affect the oscillation.

doubleSpring.playArea: Two masses connected by springs in a series. The system creates complex oscillation patterns including normal modes and Lissajous figures.
doubleSpring.controlArea: Adjust masses, spring constants, damping, and gravity for each mass and spring. Choose from presets demonstrating different oscillation modes. View graphs of positions, velocities, and energies.
doubleSpring.details: Mass 1 at {{position1}} meters, Mass 2 at {{position2}} meters. Velocities are {{velocity1}} and {{velocity2}} meters per second. Total energy {{energy}} joules.
doubleSpring.hint: Drag either mass to displace it. Try dragging them in the same direction for symmetric mode, or opposite directions for anti-symmetric mode. Press play to see the resulting motion.

pendulum.playArea: A simple pendulum with a bob suspended from a pivot point. The pendulum exhibits nonlinear behavior at large angles, demonstrating the limits of the small-angle approximation.
pendulum.controlArea: Adjust pendulum length, bob mass, damping, and gravity. Choose from presets showing different damping regimes. View graphs of angle, angular velocity, and energy over time.
pendulum.details: Pendulum angle {{angle}} degrees from vertical, angular velocity {{angularVelocity}} radians per second. Potential energy {{potentialEnergy}} joules, kinetic energy {{kineticEnergy}} joules.
pendulum.hint: Drag the bob to change the angle. Try small angles to see simple harmonic motion, or large angles to observe nonlinear behavior. Press play to watch the pendulum swing.

doublePendulum.playArea: A double pendulum with two bobs. This chaotic system demonstrates sensitive dependence on initial conditions - tiny changes in starting position lead to dramatically different motion.
doublePendulum.controlArea: Adjust lengths and masses of both pendulum segments, plus damping and gravity. Choose from presets showing energy transfer and chaotic motion. The motion trail visualizes the chaotic path.
doublePendulum.details: Upper bob at {{angle1}} degrees, lower bob at {{angle2}} degrees. Angular velocities {{angularVelocity1}} and {{angularVelocity2}} radians per second. Total energy {{energy}} joules.
doublePendulum.hint: Drag either bob to set initial conditions. Even tiny differences create wildly different outcomes. Press play and watch the chaotic dance. Try the motion trail to see the complex path.
